# Implementation Tasks: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Textbook

**Branch**: `001-physical-ai-textbook` | **Date**: 2025-12-05 | **Spec**: specs/001-physical-ai-textbook/spec.md | **Plan**: specs/001-physical-ai-textbook/plan.md

**Note**: This file is generated by the `/sp.tasks` command.

## Summary

This document outlines the detailed, ordered tasks required to build the Docusaurus site for the "Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics" textbook. Tasks focus on content conversion, Docusaurus setup, UI/UX implementation, and deployment to GitHub Pages, with an emphasis on replicating the exact PDF content and ensuring mobile-first design and accessibility.

## Tasks

### Phase 0: Project Setup

- [x] Initialize Docusaurus classic template project in `my-website/` directory.
- [x] Configure `my-website/docusaurus.config.js` with basic site metadata and settings.

### Phase 1: Content Creation

**Objective**: Create all Markdown files (`.md`) with exact content from the 9-page PDF, ensuring professional formatting and pixel-perfect tables for hardware sections.

- [x] Create `my-website/docs/intro.md` with content from the PDF "Introduction" section.
- [x] Create `my-website/docs/why-physical-ai.md` with content from the PDF "Why Physical AI Matters" section.
- [x] Create `my-website/docs/outcomes.md` with content from the PDF "Learning Outcomes" section.
- [x] Create `my-website/docs/weekly-breakdown.md` with content from the PDF "Weekly Breakdown" section.
- [x] Create `my-website/docs/assessments.md` with content from the PDF "Assessments" section.

**Checkpoint**: All core content Markdown files for modules and hardware sections are created and reviewed for fidelity.

### Phase 2: Docusaurus Configuration & UI/UX

- [x] Auto-generate `my-website/sidebars.js` to ensure proper nesting and navigation based on the `docs/` folder structure.
- [x] Implement mobile-first design considerations across the Docusaurus site using `src/css/` and responsive components.
- [x] Integrate accessibility best practices (WCAG 2.1 AA) for navigation, content, and interactive elements.
- [x] Implement custom Docusaurus components or CSS overrides in `my-website/src/` to achieve pixel-perfect rendering for any complex PDF layouts or styling not handled by default Markdown.

### Phase 3: Deployment

- [ ] Execute `npm run deploy` to build and deploy the Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages.
